title: Exercise 1.3: Console Input and Output
description: Read two integers from the user and display a calculated summary using both C and C++ I/O techniques.

tests.name: cpp_handles_positive_numbers
tests.description: Program should echo results for the input 5 and 9

tests.name: cpp_handles_mixed_values
tests.description: Program should echo results for the input 12 and 3

hints: Use std::cin >> value; to read values from the console
Remember that subtraction order matters: difference should be first minus second
Print each label exactly as shown (Sum:, Difference:, Product:)
Include std::endl after each line to add a newline

variants.title: Exercise 1.3A: Input and Output in C

tests.name: c_handles_positive_numbers
tests.description: Program should echo results for the input 7 and 4

tests.name: c_handles_negative
tests.description: Program should echo results when the second number is larger

hints: Remember to include <stdio.h> for scanf and printf
Use the & operator when reading values with scanf
Print results using the labels Sum:, Difference:, and Product:
Add a newline (\n) after each printf call

variants.title: Exercise 1.3B: Input and Output in C++

tests.name: cpp_handles_positive_numbers
tests.description: Program should echo results for the input 5 and 9

tests.name: cpp_handles_mixed_values
tests.description: Program should echo results for the input 12 and 3

hints: Use std::cin to read input and check that both values are captured
Compute all three results before printing them
Keep the labels identical to the sample output
